explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 55degC (c.c.) (ICSC (2004)). Classified into Class 3, Packing Group III (UN#2325) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 550degC (ICSC, 2004))

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN#2325) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Because the rat LC50 value of 4,900ppm, calculated from the testing data of rat LC50 (inhalation of mist) of 24mg/L (4 hours) (CERI Hazard Data 2001-51 (2002)), exceeded the saturated vapour concentration (3,300ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 330Pa (25degC) (CERI Hazard Data 2001-51 (2002)), the substance was considered as "mist exposure" and was classified based on standard values expressed in mg/L.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-51 (2002)): "The substance induced erythema and edema; reported as skin irritant in EEC classification," "moderate irritation observed." Although the results are not those of 4-hour application, the substance is considered "moderately irritating" and classified into Category 2.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-51 (2002)): "mildly irritating" (though exposure duration is unknown).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: A case of human occupational exposure is reported in CERI Hazard Data 2001-51 (2002); "27 workers who had been exposed to the substance for several years throughout manufacturing process of products containing 30% 1,3,5-trimethylbenzene and 50% 1,2,4-trimethylbenzene (hydrocarbon concentration of vapour: 10-60ppm) exhibited symptoms of oversensitiveness, tension, anxiety and bronchial asthma." However, the material contained isomers and no information is available on 1,3,5-trimethylbenzene per se, it was decided not to use this specific observation for classification.

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in CERI Hazard Data 2001-51 (2002).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "sedative effect observed at 5,075-7,105ppm; areflexia and central nervous system disorder at 7,105-9,135ppm" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-51 (2002)).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours LC50=6000microg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2002) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and the bio-accumulation potential was low (BCF=342(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 2.
